text: Which of the following carrier frequencies is illegal for LSB AFSK emissions on the 17 meter band RTTY and data segment of 18.068 to 18.110 MHz?
To what type of regulations does PRB-1 apply?
choices: Use of wireless devices in vehicles

text: What is meant by IARP?
choices: An international amateur radio permit that allows U.S. amateurs to operate in certain countries of the Americas
The internal amateur radio practices policy of the FCC
An indication of increased antenna reflected power
A forecast of intermittent aurora radio propagation

text: Which VHF amateur bands have frequencies authorized for space stations?
What must the VE team do with the application form if the examinee does not pass the exam?
choices: Return the application document to the examinee
Maintain the application form with the VEC’s records
Send the application form to the FCC and inform the FCC of the grade

text: Which of the following conditions apply when transmitting spread spectrum emissions?
choices: A station transmitting SS emission must not cause harmful interference to other stations employing other authorized emissions
The transmitting station must be in an area regulated by the FCC or in a country that permits SS emissions
The transmission must not be used to obscure the meaning of any communication

text: What are Keplerian elements?
choices: Parameters that define the orbit of a satellite
Phase reversing elements in a Yagi antenna
High-emission heater filaments used in magnetron tubes
Encrypting codes used for spread spectrum modulation

text: How many horizontal lines make up a fast-scan (NTSC) television frame?
Which of the following frequencies are sometimes used for amateur radio mesh networks?
choices: HF frequencies where digital communications are permitted
Frequencies shared with various unlicensed wireless data services
The 60 meter band channel centered on 5373 kHz

text: How can an APRS station be used to help support a public service communications activity?
choices: An APRS station with an emergency medical technician can automatically transmit medical data to the nearest hospital
APRS stations with General Personnel Scanners can automatically relay the participant numbers and time as they pass the check points
An APRS station with a Global Positioning System unit can automatically transmit information to show a mobile station’s position during the event

text: What is the most common data rate used for HF packet?
What characterizes libration fading of an EME signal?
choices: A slow change in the pitch of the CW signal
A gradual loss of signal as the sun rises
The returning echo is several hertz lower in frequency than the transmitted signal

text: Which amateur bands typically support long-path propagation?
What does the value of Bz (B sub Z) represent?
choices: Direction and strength of the interplanetary magnetic field

text: Which of the following limits the highest frequency signal that can be accurately displayed on a digital oscilloscope?
choices: Sampling rate of the analog-to-digital converter

text: What is the significance of voltmeter sensitivity expressed in ohms per volt?
choices: The full scale reading of the voltmeter multiplied by its ohms per volt rating will indicate the input impedance of the voltmeter
When used as a galvanometer, the reading in volts multiplied by the ohms per volt rating will determine the power drawn by the device under test
When used as an ohmmeter, the reading in ohms divided by the ohms per volt rating will determine the voltage applied to the circuit
When used as an ammeter, the full scale reading in amps divided by ohms per volt rating will determine the size of shunt needed

text: How does a narrow-band roofing filter affect receiver performance?
choices: It improves sensitivity by reducing front end noise
It improves intelligibility by using low Q circuitry to reduce ringing
It improves dynamic range by attenuating strong signals near the receive frequency

text: What is the term for spurious signals generated by the combination of two or more signals in a non-linear device or circuit?
What problem can occur when using an automatic notch filter (ANF) to remove interfering carriers while receiving CW signals?
choices: Removal of the CW signal as well as the interfering carrier
Any nearby signal passing through the DSP system will overwhelm the desired signal
Received CW signals will appear to be modulated at the DSP clock frequency
Ringing in the DSP filter will completely remove the spaces between the CW characters

text: How is the Q of an RLC parallel resonant circuit calculated?
choices: Reactance of either the inductance or capacitance divided by the resistance
Reactance of either the inductance or capacitance multiplied by the resistance
Resistance divided by the reactance of either the inductance or capacitance
Reactance of the inductance multiplied by the reactance of the capacitance

text: What is the relationship between the AC current through a capacitor and the voltage across a capacitor?
choices: Voltage and current are in phase
Voltage and current are 180 degrees out of phase

text: What coordinate system is often used to display the resistive, inductive, and/or capacitive reactance components of impedance?
What is the power factor of an RL circuit having a 45-degree phase angle between the voltage and the current?
What term indicates the frequency at which the grounded-base current gain of a transistor has decreased to 0.7 of the gain obtainable at 1 kHz?
What is the failure mechanism when a junction diode fails due to excessive current?
In Figure E6-3, what is the schematic symbol for a NOR gate?
What devices are commonly used as VHF and UHF parasitic suppressors at the input and output terminals of a transistor HF amplifier?
Which of the following component package types would be most suitable for use at frequencies above the HF range?
Which describes an optical shaft encoder?
choices: A device that detects rotation of a control by interrupting a light source with a patterned wheel
A device that measures the strength of a beam of light using analog to digital conversion
A digital encryption device often used to encrypt spacecraft control signals
A device for generating RTTY signals by means of a rotating light source

text: What logical operation is performed by an exclusive NOR gate?
choices: It produces logic 0 at its output only if all inputs are logic 0
It produces logic 1 at its output only if all inputs are logic 1
It produces logic 0 at its output if only one input is logic 1
It produces logic 1 at its output if only one input is logic 1

text: In Figure E7-1, what is the purpose of R1 and R2?
What is a crystal lattice filter?
choices: A power supply filter made with interlaced quartz crystals
An audio filter made with four quartz crystals that resonate at 1 kHz intervals
A filter using lattice-shaped quartz crystals for high-Q performance
A filter with narrow bandwidth and steep skirts made using quartz crystals ~~

text: What is the dropout voltage of an analog voltage regulator?
choices: Minimum input voltage for rated power dissipation
Maximum output voltage drops when the input voltage is varied over its specified range
Minimum input-to-output voltage required to maintain regulation
Maximum that the output voltage may decrease at rated load

text: Which of the following can be used to generate FM phone emissions?
choices: A balanced modulator on the audio amplifier
A reactance modulator on the oscillator
A reactance modulator on the final amplifier
A balanced modulator on the oscillator

text: What function is performed by a Fast Fourier Transform?
choices: Converting analog signals to digital form
Converting digital signals to analog form
Converting digital signals from the time domain to the frequency domain

text: What is meant by the term “op-amp input offset voltage”?
choices: The output voltage of the op-amp minus its input voltage
The difference between the output voltage of the op-amp and the input voltage required in the immediately following stage
The differential input voltage needed to bring the open loop output voltage to zero
The potential between the amplifier input terminals of the op-amp in an open loop condition

text: What are three oscillator circuits used in amateur radio equipment?
What is the approximate ratio of PEP-to-average power in a typical single-sideband phone signal?
Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing is a technique used for which type of amateur communication?
choices: OFDM signals are not allowed on amateur bands

text: What is the bandwidth of a 4800-Hz frequency shift, 9600-baud ASCII FM transmission?
What spread spectrum communications technique uses a high-speed binary bit stream to shift the phase of an RF carrier?
What is included in the total resistance of an antenna system?
What is the far field of an antenna?
choices: The region of the ionosphere where radiated power is not refracted
The region where radiated power dissipates over a specified time period
The region where radiated field strengths are constant
The region where the shape of the antenna pattern is independent of distance

text: Which of the following describes a G5RV antenna?
choices: A multi-band dipole antenna fed with coax and a balun through a selected length of open wire transmission line
A phased array antenna consisting of multiple loops
A wide band dipole using shorted coaxial cable for the radiating elements and fed with a 4:1 balun

text: What happens as the Q of an antenna increases?
choices: More common-mode current is present on the feed line

text: What parameter describes the interactions at the load end of a mismatched transmission line?
What impedance does a 1/4-wavelength transmission line present to a generator when the line is open at the far end?
choices: The same as the characteristic impedance of the line
The same as the input impedance to the generator

text: How are the wavelength scales on a Smith chart calibrated?
choices: In fractions of transmission line electrical frequency
In fractions of transmission line electrical wavelength
In fractions of antenna electrical wavelength
In fractions of antenna electrical frequency

text: When constructing a Beverage antenna, which of the following factors should be included in the design to achieve good performance at the desired frequency?
choices: Its overall length must not exceed 1/4 wavelength
It must be mounted more than 1 wavelength above ground
It should be configured as a four-sided loop
It should be one or more wavelengths long

text: What is one of the potential hazards of operating in the amateur radio microwave bands?
choices: The high gain antennas commonly used can result in high exposure levels
Microwaves often travel long distances by ionospheric reflection
The extremely high frequency energy can damage the joints of antenna structures
